STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
March 10, 2025
Mack McGhee
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility
5301 Russell Street
Detroit, MI 48211-2500
Re: License #: CE821001676
SI #: 2025SIC0000185
Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000185
Special Investigation Intake Date: December 9, 2024
License #: CE821001676
Licensee Group Organization: County of Wayne
Licensee Designee: Melissa Fernandez
Chief Administrator: Mack McGhee
Agency Name: Wayne County Juvenile Detention Facility
Agency Address: 5301 Russell Street
Detroit, MI 48211-2500
License Status: Original
License Expiration Date: 02/21/2025
Capacity: 130
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
12/10/2024 Phone Interview
12/12/2024 Phone Interview
12/17/2024 Onsite Inspection Unannounced Visit; Interview
12/18/2024 Phone Interview; Youth A’s worker
12/18/2024 Email Documentation received
12/19/2024 Phone Interview
12/19/2024 Email Documentation received
12/26/2024 Onsite Inspection Announced Visit; Interview; Other
1/3/2025 Phone Interview
1/8/2025 Email Documentation received
1/13/2025 Phone Interview
1/14/2025 Onsite Inspection Announced Visit; Interview
1/22/2025 Phone Interview
1/22/2025 Email Documentation received
1/23/2025 Onsite Inspection Documentation received
1

1/27/2025 Phone Interview; Youth A’s worker
1/27/2025 Video Conference Another DHHS agency pre-exit
meeting
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & R 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, dental and behavioral health
care.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth got into a fight with his peer and injured his hand at his
previous placement. Youth told staff that his hand hurt and was
told to "put ice on it". Youth was never examined for his injury. It is
unknown if an incident report was filed. Youth transferred to
another placement. It was discovered that youth has a fracture in
his 5th metacarpal on the right hand due to the fight.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 12/19/2024 by phone.
Complainant does not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 12/17/2024 at his current placement
with Department of Health and Human Service (DHHS) Worker 1.
Youth A was observed with a round bump near the outer edge of
his right hand below his pinky finger about ½ inch in diameter.
Youth A denied pain or discomfort and opened and closed his
right hand without issue. Youth A stated the bump developed in
2022 after he lost a basketball game and punched a wall at the
community recreation center. Youth A stated since then he
aggravated this injury by playing basketball, punching walls and
fighting. Youth A stated he was placed at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention at the Hamtramck, Michigan location on 07/16/2024.
Youth A stated he punched a wall on 08/21/2024 on Unit H and
refused to see a nurse about his right hand. Youth A stated he
injured his right hand twice on 11/20/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention at the Detroit, Michigan location. Youth A
stated he swung on a youth (chose not to disclose youth’s name)
with his right hand and later punched his room wall with his right
2

hand when a visitor did not show up for visitation day. Youth A
stated the bump on his right hand moved further below his pinky
after 11/20/2024 and he saw a nurse and a doctor. Youth A stated
he was placed at his current placement on 12/6/2024. Youth A
stated he went to Children’s Hospital of Detroit on 12/13/2024 for
x-rays of his right hand and received a wrap for his right hand.
Youth A stated he took off the wrap because he is right-handed
and could not do much wearing the wrap. Youth A was advised to
speak with health service staff regarding his hand wrap.
Youth B was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Youth B stated
Youth A’s right hand was injured and wrapped from a physical
altercation injury on another unit. Youth B stated Youth A had a
bump on his right hand but did not complain of pain or discomfort.
Youth C was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Youth C stated
Youth A had a bump below his middle or ring finger on either his
right or left hand from a knuckle injury. Youth C stated nursing
staff wrapped Youth A’s hand after Youth A said he punched his
room wall in either 09/2024 or 10/2024 after receiving a “bad”
phone call.
Youth D was identified through incident report review that he was
involved in a physical altercation with Youth A on 11/20/2024.
Youth D was discharged home from Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Attempts to interview Youth D by phone were made on
01/03/2025 and 01/13/2025. A return call message could not be
left because the voicemail box is not set up.
Team Lead was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Team Lead
stated she spoke with Youth A because he was upset when she
was on Unit 3D making unit rounds. Team Lead stated Youth A
approached Youth D with a fighting demeanor and swung and
connected with Youth D’s upper body. Team Lead stated a nurse
was called to assess Youth A and Youth D after the incident.
Team lead does not recall Youth A having a bump on his right
hand.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/22/2025 by phone with DHHS
Worker 1 because she was assigned to Unit 3D on 11/20/2024.
Staff 1 does not recall Youth A or Youth D. Staff 1 stated she was
hired on 11/04/2024 and still learning staff and youth names on
3

11/20/2024. Staff 1 did not recall working on a unit with a youth
with an injured hand or a hand wrapped up.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/27/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was upset on 11/20/2024 because his mother did not
attend Thanksgiving dinner at Wayne County Juvenile Detention.
Staff 2 did not recall the details of Youth A’s hand injury but stated
it was not a result of hitting Youth D on 11/20/2024 because Youth
A’s hand was already wrapped up. Staff 2 did not recall how Youth
A injured his hand.
Supervisor Trainee was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne
County Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers.
Supervisor Trainee recalls taking Youth A to see a nurse for a
hand injury and his hand being wrapped after the assessment but
does not recall the date or details of the injury. Supervisor Trainee
does not recall responding to an incident between Youth A and
Youth D in 11/2024.
Supervisor was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Supervisor did
not recall responding to an incident on 11/20/2024 involving Youth
A and Youth D or an injury to Youth A’s hand. Supervisor stated
11/20/2024 was the agency’s Thanksgiving family dinner event
and Youth A was upset and cried when his mother did not attend.
Manager was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS workers. Facility
manager stated he does not recall Youth A or Youth D.
Nurse was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Nurse recalled seeing
Youth A after he punched a wall. Nurse stated Youth A’s pinky
knuckle on his right hand was pushed back (not in position). Nurse
stated Youth A told her that it was from an old injury. Nurse stated
Youth A was referred to see the doctor.
Doctor was interviewed on 01/14/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with DHHS Worker 1. Doctor reviewed her case notes
and stated she saw Youth A on 12/03/2024. Doctor stated Youth
A’s right hand was not bruised or swollen and did not report
having a tingling sensation. Doctor stated Youth A reported he
injured his right hand one to two years ago. DHHS Worker 1
showed Doctor a recent picture of Youth A’s hand. Doctor did not
recall seeing the bump on Youth A’s right hand as shown in the
4

picture. Doctor stated it is possible the scar tissue shifted making
it more pronounced.
Youth A’s Mother was interviewed on 12/18/2024 by phone.
Youth A’s mother stated Youth A injured his right hand in a
basketball game prior to being placed at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Mother stated Youth A’s hand may have been fractured
but Youth A did not want to and did not go to the hospital for an
evaluation. Mother stated Youth A’s right hand did not have a
bump below his pinky finger.
Documentation
Team Lead wrote an incident report dated 11/20/2024 at 6:20 PM.
It states Team Lead separated Youth A from Youth D on Unit 3D.
Assistance was called when Youth A tried again to physically
assault Youth D. Supervisor Trainee, Supervisor and Manager
responded to the assistance call and the incident ended. Nurse
was called. Team Lead checked incident report prompt that Youth
A was seen by health services.
Youth A’s Wayne County Juvenile Detention medical
documentation relevant to this investigation is listed below.
• 07/16/2024 Youth A admitted to Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Youth A’s initial health assessment completed
on 07/17/2024 and physical exam completed on
07/25/2025. Neither state a deformity on Youth A’s right
hand.
• 10/18/2024 Youth A seen by a nurse for right hand pain
and observed with swelling on his small right knuckle with
tenderness to the touch. Youth A given an ice pack and
ibuprofen. Youth A’s name added to doctor call line for
further evaluation. Youth A instructed to notify staff of
changes.
• 10/21/2024 Youth A seen by a doctor. Youth A denied
recent trauma or injury to his right hand. Youth A stated his
right hand was injured two years ago when he punched a
locker and it healed without treatment. Youth A denied
edema, erythema, numbness, tingling or decreased range
of motion. Youth A is in stable condition with an old
deformity of his fifth metacarpal bone on his right hand.
Youth A treated with compression and as needed pain
medication.
• 10/23/2024 Youth A seen by a nurse for right hand, small
finger knuckle, pain that is tender to the touch with swelling.
Redness and discoloration are not apparent. Youth A given
5

an ice pack and ibuprofen. Youth A instructed to notify staff
of changes.
• 11/20/2024 Youth A seen by a nurse for an old injury to his
right hand after a physical altercation with a youth. Youth
A’s pinky knuckle appears pushed back. Youth A given an
ice pack and ibuprofen.
• 12/02/2024 Youth A seen by a nurse for a prior injury to his
right pinky knuckle with deformity. Youth A states his right
hand hurts when he plays basketball.
• 12/03/2024 Youth A seen by doctor for right hand pain.
Youth A stated he injured his right hand a year ago and did
not seek medical attention. Youth A’s right fifth knuckle
healed with deformity. Youth A denies recent injury and
numbness and tingling sensation. Edema and erythema are
not noted. Youth A prescribed nonsteroid ant-inflammatory
medication and to limit use and protect right hand.
• 12/06/2024 Youth A’s nursing discharge health report does
not document a deformity or injury to Youth A’s right hand.
Youth A’s medical documentation from his current placement
relevant to this investigation is listed below.
• 12/06/2024 Youth A observed with swelling on his right fifth
metacarpal. Doctor ordered orthopedic consult when x-ray
showed a fracture. Youth A stated he injured his hand at
Wayne County Juvenile Detention during a physical
altercation.
• 12/06/2024 Trident Care radiology report states Youth A
has a prior transverse fracture on his right fifth metacarpal
shaft with approximately 50 degrees of apex dorsal
angulation but no displacement. It states partial bridging
callus at volar aspect with soft tissue swelling and without
joint degeneration.
• 12/13/2024 Youth A seen at Children’s Hospital of Detroit.
Evaluation states Youth A’s grip strength and range of
motion are not compromised. Youth A stated he punched a
wall on three occasions causing soreness and pain. Youth
A’s right hand is healing with callus formation.
• 12/13/2024 Detroit Medical Center – Orthopedic Surgery
reviewed Youth A’s radiographs and met with Youth A.
Evaluation states Youth A’s right fifth metacarpal shaft
appears broken multiple times and is currently healing. It
does not require immobilization or orthopedic intervention.
Youth A can return to activity as tolerated with limiting
contact sports and hitting things to decrease risk of reinjury.
6

Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing medical
assessment and treatment for Youth A’s right hand pain and
callus bump. Youth A and his mother stated Youth A’s right hand
injury originated when he was in the community.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 12/17/2024 at his current placement
with DHHS Worker 1. Youth A did not share details or concerns
with staff intervening in his 11/20/2024 physical altercation with a
youth, who is identified as Youth D.
Youth D was discharged home from Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Attempts to interview Youth D by phone were made on
01/03/2025 and 01/13/2025. A return call message was not left
because the voicemail box is not set up. Team Lead interview and
incident report identifies Youth D being hit by Youth A on
11/20/2024.
Team Lead was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS Workers. Team Lead
stated Youth A approached and swung on Youth D and Youth D
swung back in self-defense. Team Lead stated she called for
assistance and stepped between Youth A and Youth D to
separate them. Team Lead stated she did not perform a primary
restraint technique hold on Youth A or Youth D.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/22/2025 by phone with DHHS
Worker 1. Staff 1 stated she does not recall Youth A or Youth D.
7

Staff 1 stated she was hired on 11/04/2024 and was learning the
job and learning staff and youth names on 11/20/2024.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/27/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was upset on 11/20/2024 because his mother did not
attend Thanksgiving dinner at Wayne County Juvenile Detention
and directed his disappointment towards Youth D. Staff 2 stated
Youth A attempted but was unsuccessful in hitting Youth D. Staff 2
stated Youth A and Youth D were not physically managed in this
incident.
Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor were interviewed separately
on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention with two other
DHHS Workers. Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor do not recall
responding to an incident involving Youth A and Youth D.
Manager was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS workers. Manager stated
he does not recall Youth A or Youth D.
Video
11/20/2024 at 6:23 PM Unit 3D video shows Team Lead walking
with Youth A and another youth by the staff desk. It shows Youth
A exchanges words and taps the other youth on his upper chest
using his hand. Team Lead extends her arm out in front of Youth
A and walks towards Youth A as Youth A steps back. Youth A
maneuvers past Team Lead, runs and swings his arms at Youth
D. Youth D swings his arms back at Youth A. Team Lead uses her
walkie talkie before handing it to a female staff. This female staff
uses the walkie talkie as Team Lead intervenes by positioning
herself between Youth A and Youth D. Team Lead physically
guides Youth A by touching his upper arms or upper body into a
corner by one of the unit entrance doors. Two female staff
approach and stand with Team Lead in front of Youth A in the
corner. Youth A’s arms are raised above his head. Team Lead
and two female staff talk with Youth A and without physically
holding Youth A. Youth A tries to push past Team Lead and the
two female staff. One of the female staff holds Youth A’s right arm
up and uses her body to physically block Youth A from moving
away from the corner as Team Lead moves behind Youth A and
the other female staff moves closer towards Youth A and prevents
Youth A from leaving the corner. Staff responding to the
assistance call arrive on the unit at 6:24 PM and direct youths
away from the corner Youth A is in. Youth A breaks free from
Team Lead and the two female staff in the corner and runs to the
opposite side. Male staff that responded to the assistance call
8

block Youth A from moving across the unit by extending their arms
out and holding Youth A’s arm and hand. Two male staff position
themselves with one on each side of Youth A as Youth A slides
down to sit with his back against the outside gym wall. A female
staff opens room 9’s door located next to the outside gym wall.
The two male staff maneuver Youth A from his sitting position to
room 9. (Video does not capture staff movements due to staff
blocking the camera view.) Third male staff follows Youth A and
two male staff into room 9. Three male staff exit room 9 before the
door is closed.
Documentation
Team Lead wrote an incident report dated 11/20/2024 at 6:20 PM.
It states Team Lead separated Youth A from Youth D on Unit 3D.
Assistance was called when Youth A tried again to physically
assault Youth D. Supervisor Trainee, Supervisor and Manager
responded to the assistance call and the incident ended. Team
Lead did not check incident report prompt that Youth A was
restrained.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention is authorized to use Handle
with Care when physical management is necessary.
Unit 3D
Unit 3D has two entrance and exit doors. Upon entering the unit, a
classroom is located between the two entrance and exit doors. A
sink counter adjoins the front classroom wall and a staff desk runs
parallel in front of the sink counter. Across from the staff desk is
the unit gym. The unit has two shower stalls located in the far-right
corner on the same wall as the entrance and exit doors upon
entering the unit. Youth rooms surround the common area of the
unit to the right and left of the staff desk.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for controlling Youth A’s
movement and not identifying it as physical management and not
using Handle with Care techniques.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
MiSACWIS incident reports are based on staff’s written incident
reports. Supervisor must review incident reports for completion
and accuracy (including restraint and seclusion) to ensure
MiSACWIS incident report can be correctly entered in the system.
CONSULTATION
Staff stepping between youths engaged in a physical altercation
poses a safety risk to the staff. Staff standing directly in front of a
9

youth and creating a staff wall is interpreted as a confrontational
stance with the potential to escalate a situation and poses a safety
risk to the staff. It is also not positioning for Handle with Care
techniques if the youth escalates and warrants physical
management.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion
Title plan; prohibitions; reduction and elimination.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (6) Staff may not place youth in seclusion for fixed periods of time.
Description Staff must release the youth from seclusion as soon as the youth
has regained self-control and is no longer engaging in behavior
that threatens immediate harm to the youth or others.
Violation Additional Finding
Type
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 12/17/2024 at his current placement
with DHHS worker 1. Youth A did not share details or concerns
with staff intervening in his 11/20/2024 physical altercation with a
youth, who is identified as Youth D.
Youth D was discharged home from Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Attempts to interview Youth D by phone were made on
01/03/2025 and 01/13/2025. A return call message was not left
because the voicemail box is not set up. Team Lead and incident
report identifies Youth D as being hit by Youth A on 11/20/2024.
Team Lead was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS workers. Team Lead
stated Youth A was placed in his room with the door closed and
locked for 15 minutes of reflection time for fighting Youth D.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/22/2025 by phone with DHHS
worker 1. Staff 1 stated she does not recall Youth A or Youth B.
Staff 1 stated she was hired on 11/04/2024 and was learning the
job and learning staff and youth names on 11/20/2024.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 01/27/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Youth A was unsuccessful in hitting Youth D and walked into his
room on his own on 11/20/2024.
10

Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor were interviewed on
12/26/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile Detention with two other
DHHS Workers. Supervisor Trainee and Supervisor do not recall
responding to an incident involving Youth A and Youth D.
Manager was interviewed on 12/26/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with two other DHHS workers. Facility
manager stated he does not recall Youth A or Youth D.
Video
11/20/2024 at 6:26 PM Unit 3D video shows Youth A is placed in
room 9 and room 9’s door is closed at 6:26 PM. (Youth room
doors are secured from the inside and outside the room.)
Documentation
Team Lead wrote an incident report dated 11/20/2024 at 6:20 PM.
Team Lead did not check incident report prompt that Youth A was
secluded.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention Room Time Safety Security
Check Observation form states Supervisor Trainee placed Youth
A in Unit 3D room 9 on 11/20/2024 from 6:27 PM to 7:00 PM for
physical assault of a youth. On the back of this form is Room Time
Safety Security Check Observation Log. It lists the following:
6:26 PM Youth A enters room 9 and door secured.
6:36 PM Youth A seen by medical.
6:39 PM Youth A standing in door.
6:46 PM Management counseled Youth A.
7:00 PM Youth A prepared for shower.
7:10 PM Youth A released from room.
Wayne County Juvenile Detention requested a variance to use
seclusion when a youth becomes an imminent danger to self or
others and de-escalation techniques have failed. This variance
was approved by Division of Child Welfare Licensing Director.
Initial seclusion variance requested on 08/26/2024 and approved
with 10/26/2024 expiration date. Second seclusion variance
requested on 10/23/2024 and approved with 12/23/2024
expiration date. Third seclusion variance requested on 12/20/2024
and approved with 02/20/2025 expiration date. The following is
stated in the variance. “Staff may not place youth in seclusion for
fixed periods of time. Staff must release the youth from seclusion
as soon as the youth has regained self-control and is no longer
engaging in behavior that threatens immediate harm to the youth
or others.”
11

Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance for placing Youth A in
seclusion for a fixed period of time on 11/20/2024.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
02/24/2025
________________________________________
Vivian D Malleck Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
03/10/2025

12
